step1.sentence: Learning grammar well gives students a strong foundation for mastering any language.

step2.story: The company had built a strong foundation during five unglamorous years of slow growth. When the market shifted in their favor, they were the only player with the operational infrastructure to scale quickly. Everyone else had to build what they had already built.

step3.story: The children's literacy program had been working in the same communities for twelve years. Evaluators who visited in year twelve found outcomes that could not have been predicted in year three, when the programs still looked modest. What the long view revealed was that the program had built a strong foundation of reading habits, parental engagement, and community literacy culture that compounded over time. The returns had not been visible in annual assessments. They had been accumulating in ways the annual metrics were not designed to capture.

meaning.nuanceKo: lay/build a strong foundation(강한 기반을 다지다)처럼 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Early childhood education provides a strong foundation for future learning.
